body:
Found a reference to the class here https://github.com/paulecoyote/xunit/blob/master/Main/xunit.extensions/DataTheories/ClassDataAttribute.cs

integrated into my project so my issue is resolved.

After read `MemberData` 's [source code](https://github.com/xunit/xunit/blob/ff6ecaaf4df79f4266e7d2ab24493e49a5133031/src/xunit.core/MemberDataAttributeBase.cs#L45), I find that `ClassData` attribute functionality has merged to `MemberData` attribute.

Do something like this:

``` cs
[MemberData("{static member}", MemberType = typeof(MyClass))]
```

- `[ClassData]` in v1 was used to _**instantiate a class which was itself enumerable**_.
- `[MemberData]` can be used to pull enumerable data from a _**static member of a class**_.

They are fundamentally two different things.
@bradwilson Sorry, I made a mistake. So, there is no official replacement for the v1 `ClassData` attribute?
What is the reason to remove it?
Will you accept such a PR?

issue.title: What happend to ClassData?

labels.name: Feature
labels.description: A request for a new feature

repository.name: xunit
repository.description: xUnit.net is a free, open source, community-focused unit testing tool for .NET.

issue.title: Added support for XUnit-ClassDataAttribute

repository.name: AutoFixture
repository.description: AutoFixture is an open source library for .NET designed to minimize the 'Arrange' phase of your unit tests in order to maximize maintainability. Its primary goal is to allow developers to focus on what is being tested rather than how to setup the test scenario, by making it easier to create object graphs containing test data.

issue.body: `ClassDataAttribute` was again added to XUnit2, [more details here](https://github.com/xunit/xunit/issues/359). This PR adds support for it by implementing new `ClassAutoDataAttribute`, so we can combine data comming from Autofixture with data comming from given Class of `ClassDataAttribute`.
